questions.text: Which throid malignancy is common after radiation exposure? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is the answer as the most common malignancy to occur after the radiation exposure is papillary carcinoma of thyroid. Follicular, medullary and anaplastic carcinoma of thyroid are not associated with radiation exposure.

choices.text: I-131 whole body scan to assess the extent of disease
CECT scan to assess any residual disease

questions.text: A 10-years old boy presented with cervical lymph adenopathy. Needle biopsy from the nodes revealed secondareis from papillary carcinoma of throid. The child under went complete removal of tumor ,total thyoidectomy and radical neck dissection. What should be the immediate next line of management? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Once you have operated on a patient of papillary carcinoma of thyroid we need to provide thyroxine externally as we have removed the thyroid tissue and it also helps to suppress any part of thissue which has been left inside. Then after about 4-6 weeks patient becomes euthyroid and then we discontinue thyroxine and put the patient on RAI so that the remaining of the tissue which is left inside is ablated by RAI. And after that we restart thyroxine and use thyroglobulin as a marker of recurrence. Bone scan is done if patient has any symptoms, like bone pain. CECT does not help to access any residual disease after thyroidectomy.

questions.text: Orphan Annie-eye nuclei seen in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Orphan Annie-eye nucleus is a characteristic feature of papillary carcinoma of thyroid on histopathological examination. Orphan Annie-eye nucleus is not seen in medullary, anaplastic, or follicular carcinoma of thyroid.

questions.text: Psammoma bodies are seen following except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) psommoma bodies are the intra nuclear inclusion bodies seen in various pathological conditions and help in making the diagnosis . Psommoma bodies are not seen in mucinous cystadenoma of ovary. Psommoma bodies are seen in : 1. Papillary carcinoma of thyroid 2. Papillary carcinoma of kidney. 3. Meningioma 4. Serous cystadenoma of ovary.

questions.text: True regarding papillary carcinoma of thyroid: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A is false as papillary carcinoma and follicular carcinoma of thyroid are the two differentiated carcinomas of the thyroid. Option B is false as papillary carcinoma of thyroid tends to have a lymphatic spread more as compared to hematogenous spread and mostly presents as a lateral aberrant thyroid enlargement. Option D is false as papillary carcinoma of thyroid is not a capsulated tumor Option C is coreect as papillary carcinoma of thyroid has a very good prognosis if treated correctly, infact among all the carcinomas of thyroid papillary carcinoma of thyroid is the one which has best prognosis.

questions.text: Which type of thyroid carcinoma has the best prognosis? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is correct as papillary carcinoma of thyroid has the best prognosis among all the types of thyroid cancer if it is treated correctly. Option B is wrong as anaplastic carcinoma of thyroid infact has the worst prognosis among all the carcinoma of the thyroid. Option C is wrong as even if the follicular carcinoma of thyroid is one of the differentiated carcinomas of thyroid it has worse prognosis as compared to papillary carcinoma of thyroid. Option D is false as medullary carcinoma has a poor prognosis and it can even be familial.

choices.text: Can be reliably diagnosed using fine neddle aspiration cytology
Typically spreads to the cervical lymph nodes
Requires a total thyroidectomy for large tumors

questions.text: One of the following is not correct in papillary carcinoma of thyroid: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The correct answer to this question is option B as papillary carcinoma of thyroid can be either unifocal or multifocal. Option A is correct as papillary carcinoma of thyroid can be diagnosed on FNAC, FNAC is not helpful in distinguishing follicular adenoma from follicular carcinoma. Option C is correct as papillary carcinoma of thyroid typically spreads to cervical lymphnodes and presents as a lateral aberrant thyroid tissue. Option D is also correct as once the diagnosis of papillary carcinoma of thyroid has been made we have to go for complete thyroidectomy for these patients.

questions.text: Cervical lympoh node involvement in papillary carcinoma thyroid, best treatment is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) When you have a papillary carcinoma of thyroid the treatment of choice is thyroidectomy. If you have a lymph node involvement along with papillary carcinoma of thyroid we have to go for a modified radical neck dissection. As modified radical neck dissection is not in the option we will chose radical neck dissection as an answer. Option A is not the correct answer for this question as even though you give radioactive iodine in Papillary carcinoma of thyroid we give it for tumor ablation of the residual tumor cells. It is not directed specifically for the enlarged lymphnodes. Chemotherapy and steroids do not have any specific role in treatment of papillary carcinoma of thyroid

questions.text: Which of the following is used in the treatment of differentiated thyroid cancer? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) I 131 is a radioactive isotope which is used in the treatment of differentiated thyroid cancer. Iodine from the blood is actively taken by the thyroid gland and used for the formation of thyroxine. I 131 emits beta rays and gamma rays, beta rays are responsible for the destruction of the thyroid cancer tissue. 99m Tc is used for the bone scan not the thyroid scan as it is not taken up by the thyroid tissue. It can help In making the diagnosis of bony metastasis in thyroid cancer. P-32 and I-131 MIBG is not used for thyroid scan as they are not taken up by the thyroid tissue.

questions.text: In treatment of papillary carcinomas thyroid, radioiodine destroys the neoplastic cells predominatly by:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Radioactive iodine emits beta rays and are effective for the destruction the thyroid tumors. Radioactive iodine does not emit X-rays and alpha rays. Radio active iodine emits gamma rays, they are helpful for the detection of the uptake area in the scans and responsible for the side effects .

questions.text: Follicular carcinoma of thyroid is due to mutation of:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Genetic mutation associated with follicular carcinoma of thyroid is RAS. Option C that is RET gene mutation is associated with medullary carcinoma of thyroid.

questions.text: Lymph node metastasis is least commonly seen with:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Follicular carcinoma of thyroid patients rarely have a lymph node metatstasis, in thise patients most of the tumors spread via blood borne route. Option A is wrong, as papillary carcinoma of thyroid is infact the most common tumor to undergo lymphnode metastases.Most of the papillary carcinoma patients come to us with a lateral aberrant thyroid which is basically an enlarged lymphnode due to papillary carcinoma of thyroid. Options B and D are false as medullary ca and anaplastic carcinoma of thyroid also give rise to lymph node metastasis commonly.

questions.text: Hurthle cells tumour is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Earlier Hurthle cell carcinoma was thought to be variant of follicular Carcinoma. But now Hurthle cell carcinoma is classified as a Separate entity. It is more aggressive and has poorer prognosis than follicular carcinoma. In hurthle cell tumor , Hurthle cells /askanazy cells are characteristic.

questions.text: True regarding follicular carcinoma of thyroid:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is correct as follicular carcinoma of thyroid have hematogenous spread which is common . Option B is wrong as follicular carcinoma of thyroid is not multifocal it is mostly unifocal. Option C is false as we can not diagnose follicular carcinoma of thyroid on FNAC we need a tissue biopsy for diagnosis. The reason is that FNAC can not pick up vascular invasion so it can not differentiate between follicular carcinoma and follicular adenoma of thyroid. Option D is wrong as follicular carcinoma of thyroid is not the most common carcinoma of thyroid gland. Most common carcinoma of thyroid gland is papillary carcinoma of thyroid.

questions.text: Screening method of medullary carcinoma thyroid is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Serum calcitonin is a tumour marker for carcinoma thyroid so it is used a screening method of medullary carcinoma of thyroid. Option B is wrong as serum calcium is a very unspecific test and can not be used to screen a particular disease as it can be altered in a lot of conditions. Option C is serum alkaline phosphatase and it is a marker for obstruction in biliary system Option D is serum acid phosphatase and it is raised in cases where we have a bony metastasis .

choices.text: Familial MTC may presents in 2nd decade

questions.text: False statement about feature of MTC: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Medullary carcinoma of thyroid arise from parafollicular C cells so they do not take up iodine and are not under the effect of TSH. Option A is correct as Familial MTC tends to present early in the life mostly in 2nd decade . Option B is correct as medullary carcinoma of thyroid have a typical amyloid stroma. Option C is correct as medullary carcinoma of thyroid patients secrete serotonin and can lead to diarrhea.

choices.text: Amyloid stroma is present on histology

questions.text: Feature(S) of medullary carcinoma thyroid
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A, B, C & D) Option A is correct as medullary carcinoma of thyroid arises from parafollicular C cells of thyroid. Option B is correct presence of amyloid stroma is the characteristic finding in a patient of medullary carcinoma of thyroid. Option C Is correct as 10-25 % patients of medullary carcinoma of thyroid are familial and associated with MEN II syndrome. Option D is correct as in patients with medullary carcinoma of thyroid serotonin is secreted and it leads to diarrhea.

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding medullary carcinoma of thyroid except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option C is wrong as patients who suffer from medullary carcinoma of thyroid are TSH independent as they arise form parafollicular C cells. Option A is correct as all patients who suffer from medullary carcinoma of thyroid need a total thyroidectomy with central node dissection. Option B is correct as medullary carcinoma of thyroid arises from parafollicular C cells. Option D is correct as C cells produce calcitonin these patients have excess amount of calcitonin and it is used as a tumor marker.

questions.text: Commonest presenting complaintsof medullary carcinoma thyroid: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is the answer as medullary carcinoma of thyroid has a tendency to form serotonin and can present as a diarrhea . Option B is wrong as medullary carcinoma of thyroid can not or very rarely cause dysphagia, in very late stages.

choices.text: Surrounding neck tissue is usually free
Some degree of differentiation to papillary and follicular type is seen

questions.text: Regarding anaplastic carcinoma which statements(s) is/are true:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A, D & E) Option A is correct as anaplastic carcinoma mostly occurs in 7th and 8th decade of life and is more common in females. Option B is wrong as anaplastic carcinoma is not encapsulated, infact it is the most aggressive form of anaplastic carcinoma. Option C is false as surrounding neck tissue is not free as it is involved very rapidly and leads to tracheal obstruction and respiratory compression. Option D is correct as In anaplastic carcinoma we do get distant metastasis as it is a malignant tumour. Option E is correct as in anaplastic carcinoma foci of more differentiated thyroid tumors, either follicular or papillary, may be seen, suggesting that anaplastic tumors arise from more well-diferentiated tumor.

questions.text: The treatment of choice for anaplastic carcinoma of thyroid Infiltrating trachea and sternum will be:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Treatment of Anaplastic carcinoma • Thyroidectomy for resectable mass (may lead to a small improvement in survival, especially in younger individuals) • Combined radiation and chemotherapy in an adjuvant setting in patients with resectable disease has been associated with prolonged survival. • Tracheostomy and palliative support to alleviate airway obstruction

choices.text: Surrouding neck tissue is usually free

questions.text: Regarding anaplastic carcinoma which statements(s) is/are true?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A, B & E) anaplastic carcinoma tends to occur in 7th or 8th decade of life. Option B is correct as anaplastic carcinoma is associated with p53 mutation. Option C is false as in anaplastic carcinoma the surrounding tissue is not free and this can even lead to respiratory tract obstruction due to fibrosis. Option D is false as there is no cure for patients of anaplastic carcinoma, their life expectancy is 6 months. Option E is correct as lymphatic spread occurs in anaplastic carcinoma.

questions.text: Metastasis in thyroid gland come most commonly from Carcinoma of:(LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Nonthyroid metastases to the thyroid gland are rare in the clinical setting, with the most common primary tumor being RCC. In autopsy series, the most common primary tumor is lung cancer

choices.text: Medullary thyroid carcinoma is associated with MEN-2A
Follicular carcinoma – Most common type of carcinoma
Thyroid lymphoma is often associated width Hashimoto thyroidistis
Anaplastic carcinoma occur in old age women

questions.text: False statement regarding thyroid carcinoma:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is the answer to this question as papillary carcinoma of thyroid is the most common form of thyroid carcinoma and not the follicular carcinoma of thyroid. Option A is correct as Medullary carcinoma of thyroid is associated with MEN-2A and 2B syndrome. Option C is correct as papillary carcinoma of thyroid is multifocal in nature . Option D is correct as thyroid lymphoma has a tendancy to be associated with hashimoto thyroiditis. Option E is correct as anaplastic carcinoma of thyroid is more common in 7th and 8th decade of life.

questions.text: Low risk in carcinoma thyroid:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B,C)

questions.text: Which of the following is not a histological variant of thyroid neoplasm? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is the answer to this question as there is no histological variant of thyroid neoplasia by the name merkel cell variant.

choices.text: Level I to V lymph nodes

questions.text: Which of the following structure is preserved in radical neck dissection
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) RND INVOLVES REMOVAL OF :- 1.I TO V LN 2.CN XI 3.IJV 4.SCM

questions.text: Which nerve injury is least likely during thyroid surgery ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Ansa cervicalis can be damaged during thyroid surgery as it lies close to thyroid on anterior wall of carotid sheath. Option B,C-External laryngeal nerve is the MOST COMMONLY INJURED nerve followed by RLN. Option D-Marginal mandibular nerve is well away from thyroid gland,hence it is least likely to be injured during thyroid surgery.

questions.text: 19-year-old girl with a neck swelling which moves with deglutition and invading surrounding structures. Most probable diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Thyroglossal cyst do not invade surrounding structures. Option B-The given image shows nuclear clearing known as Orphan annie eye nuclei,which is seen in PTC(papillary thyroid cancer).Also,it is invading surrounding structures which also favours diagnosis of malignancy. Option C-Medullary cancer thyroid will show amyloid stroma on HPE. Option D-Follicular adenoma will show multiple follicles with colloid in center of follicle.

questions.text: A 23 year old female came with complain of dysphagia and hoarseness of voice and neck swelling. Radiological evaluation revealed a radiological mass compressing the trachea. Biopsy revealed amyloid deposits with round regular cells surrounding it. What is the origin of cells?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Hurthle cells are seen in hashimoto thyroiditis. Option B-Follicular cells are seen in follicular neoplasm. Option C-Biopsy revealed amyloid deposits with round regular cells surrounding it, is s/o medullary carcinoma of thyroid,which arises from Parafollicular cells.

questions.text: 40 years old patient who was treated in past with radiation for Hodkin's Lymphoma presents with right sided thyroid swelling. FNAC reveals papillary thyroid cancer and there is no lymph node involvement. What is next step in management.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Since patient has history of radiation to thyroid,hence, it is a contraindication for hemithyroidectomy. This patient will undergo total thyroidectomy.

questions.text: A 6-month-old infant is brought to the genetic counselor due to the family history of MEN-2B. His father died of medullary thyroid carcinoma. His genetic testing was positive for the RET protooncogene mutation. Which of the following will be the best line of management that will improve the prognosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Patients at risk for MEN 2A or MEN 2B, or with a positive family history, should be screened annually for: - Pheochromocytoma: Urine VMA - Hyperparathyroidism: Serum calcium - Medullary carcinoma: Serum calcitonin Routine RET mutation testing is recommended for at-risk family members. Prophylactic thyroidectomy is advised before age 6 for MEN2A and before age 1 for MEN2B.

questions.text: Thyroid biopsy of a patient showed the presence of Hurthle cells. Antibodies found in this condition are:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Anti - TPO In the context of Hurthle cells, which are often associated with conditions like Hashimoto's thyroiditis, the most relevant antibodies are Anti-TPO (Anti-Thyroid Peroxidase). Anti-TPO antibodies are commonly found in patients with autoimmune thyroid conditions, including Hashimoto's thyroiditis, where Hurthle cells may be present.
